intro: Uragoga agnata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a compact rosette of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated by insects. Uragoga agnata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
